channel.title: Moments of Grace
channel.description: Moments of Grace is a daily devotioncast, featuring Evangelist and Pastor, Rev. Al Dagel.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Feed your spirit today.
channel.itunes:author: GraceMode
channel.itunes:summary: Moments of Grace is a daily devotioncast, featuring Evangelist and Pastor, Rev. Al Dagel.

item.title: Encouraging the persecuted
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares his heart, as he considers the plight of the persecuted Christians around the world. Without sharing specifics that may endanger some, Pastor Al instead shares biblical accounts and an anecdotal story to make the unmistakable point, in order to encourage the persecuted.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares his heart, as he considers the plight of the persecuted Christians around the world. Without sharing specifics that may endanger some, Pastor Al instead shares biblical accounts and an anecdotal story to make the unmistakable point, in order to encourage the persecuted.

item.title: Let me serve in my own way.
item.description: Have you ever been bad-mouthed for serving God in your own style? Pastor Al Dagel wants us to understand that serving God is truly a matter of the heart. Sometimes we just don't need other people's opinions to do it right. Listen, and see if you agree.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever been bad-mouthed for serving God in your own style? Pastor Al Dagel wants us to understand that serving God is truly a matter of the heart. Sometimes we just don't need other people's opinions to do it right. Listen, and see if you agree.

item.title: Reason for Monday praises
item.description: Thank God its Monday! Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us why he believes that Mondays are a great way to start our weeks. He gives us ample reason to praise the Lord. Join him in that praise here on "Moments of Grace".
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Thank God its Monday! Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us why he believes that Mondays are a great way to start our weeks. He gives us ample reason to praise the Lord. Join him in that praise here on "Moments of Grace".

item.title: Pray like Elijah
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us how to pray with great power, just like Elijah. There is no secret here, but many have never even tried.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us how to pray with great power, just like Elijah. There is no secret here, but many have never even tried.

item.title: One verse is like many verses
item.description: What we see in Leviticus 26:14-46, we can also find in Romans 6:23. Listen, as Pastor Al brings the two together for our benefit. (Saturdays are great days to share a link to "Moments of Grace".

item.title: Obedience in Leviticus
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel found chapter 26 of the Book of Leviticus to be a blessing. Today, he gives us a start in "getting the blessings of obedience", but he challenges us to dig a little deeper for the rest of the riches in the chapter.

item.title: How to glorify God
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel finishes a three part series on Psalm 19. This Psalm really ends well.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel finishes a three part series on Psalm 19. This Psalm really ends well.

item.title: His Word and His glory
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel continues his look at the 19th Psalm. We believe that you will see sense in the sweetness of God's Word.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel continues his look at the 19th Psalm. We believe that you will see sense in the sweetness of God's Word.

item.title: Thinking of you
item.description: Today's "Moments of Grace" speaks of the declaration of God's glory, spoken eloquently by His own creation, as voiced in the 19th Psalm. Join Pastor Al Dagel, as he shares today's devotioncast from a couch on his patio in his own back yard. Let's join him there.

item.title: I remember
item.description: Today, the United States of America celebrates Memorial Day. For all of us around the world, we have good reason to remember the One Who paid for our freedom! Freedom is not free. It comes with a price, only to be offered freely.

item.title: Reasons to praise the Lord
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel wanted to name today's episode of "Moments of Grace" "A million reasons to praise the Lord", but there wasn't room. Nontheless, we believe that you will certainly find reason to praise the Lord today. Just listen!

item.title: A clean wicker basket
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares what he hops will be a word of encouragement for those of us who get frustrated because we can't remember Bible portions that we just read.

item.title: Walking with the Great I AM
item.description: How is your walk with God? Let us never get tired of that question! Pastor Al Dagel shares some helpful insight into that walk in today's episode of "Moments of Grace".
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: How is your walk with God? Let us never get tired of that question! Pastor Al Dagel shares some helpful insight into that walk in today's episode of "Moments of Grace".

item.title: He was still blind
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells of two beggars, one who was helped but remained blind, and one who was helped by Jesus. That beggar received his sight, and he became a follower of Jesus. How is your vision today?
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells of two beggars, one who was helped but remained blind, and one who was helped by Jesus. That beggar received his sight, and he became a follower of Jesus. How is your vision today?

item.title: Getting in shape
item.description: Many of us get a daily exercise workout to keep in shape, physically. How do you stay in shape spiritually? Today, Pastor Al Dagel sheds a little light on that subjuct. Enjoy

item.title: Don't keep the Father waiting
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel finishes this three day excursion into the world of the "Lost and Found", as taught by Jesus in Luke 15. Just make sure that you are no longer lost. Need help? 1gracemode@gmail.com

item.title: The lost coin was found!
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel continues a three part series on Luke 15's lost and found teachings of Jesus. We are in for a great week of teaching. Don't miss a single day! Listen, tell your friends, "share" and "like" this episode.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel continues a three part series on Luke 15's lost and found teachings of Jesus. We are in for a great week of teaching. Don't miss a single day! Listen, tell your friends, "share" and "like" this episode.

item.title: The lost is found!
item.description: Praise God that being lost, although it is a terminal condition, is a situation that Jesus can reverse. Pastor Al Dagel wants us to realize that we can be found by our Good Shepherd, and being found means that we are no longer lost!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Praise God that being lost, although it is a terminal condition, is a situation that Jesus can reverse. Pastor Al Dagel wants us to realize that we can be found by our Good Shepherd, and being found means that we are no longer lost!

item.title: Hypocrites
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel warns us about hypocrisy, but he also helps us understand what it is all about. There are times when many of us could easily and honestly be called hypocrites. Don't make a habit of it!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel warns us about hypocrisy, but he also helps us understand what it is all about. There are times when many of us could easily and honestly be called hypocrites. Don't make a habit of it!

item.title: A twinkle in a moment
item.description: today's episome of "Moments of Grace" will only taka a few moments, but the return of Jesus will only take a twinkle in a moment. Let's be ready when He comes!

item.itunes:summary: today's episome of "Moments of Grace" will only taka a few moments, but the return of Jesus will only take a twinkle in a moment. Let's be ready when He comes!

item.title: How God provides...
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel gleans some thoughts of encouragement from the last part of the Book of Exodus. You won't want to miss today's episode.

item.title: On the Lord's side
item.description: Would you enjoy being likened to Satan? Pastor Al Dagel paints a picture that might make us think that we, too could be on the wrong side, just as impetuous Peter was. Be careful to get your marching orders from the right source.

item.title: My old friends
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares the excitement of getting together with his old friends, who always teach him the ways of the Lord. Who are those old friends? ... You may be surprised when you hear Pastor Al identify those friends. Listen now, and tell others about "Moments of Grace".

item.title: Our time together
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel loves his time before the microphone each day, because he so enjoys sharing what God has put on his heart with you! Listen today, so that you can be ready to share with others what God has done for you.

item.title: A very special mom
item.description: Happy Mothers' Day to all of the moms out there! Today, Pastor Al Dagel talks about a very special mom. Of course all moms are special, but this one is even referred to in both the old and new testaments of the Holy Bible.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode

item.title: Honoring our Father
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel takes note that tomorrow is "Mothers' Day", and he takes the opportunity to point us in the direction of honoring both our mothers and fathers and our heavenly Father.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Al Dagel takes note that tomorrow is "Mothers' Day", and he takes the opportunity to point us in the direction of honoring both our mothers and fathers and our heavenly Father.

item.title: Do the right thing!
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel encourages us to be like Philemon, and do the right thing. It may be hard, but sometimes, forgiveness is all we need to offer to be more like the Master.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel encourages us to be like Philemon, and do the right thing. It may be hard, but sometimes, forgiveness is all we need to offer to be more like the Master.

item.title: Power walking
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares a biblical view of where we can gain power to walk a walk of holiness and strength.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares a biblical view of where we can gain power to walk a walk of holiness and strength.

item.title: God is our Keeper
item.description: When Cain dismissed his brother's death by asking God, "Am I my brother's keeper?", another piece of the "puzzle" of God's plan for the redemption of mankind fell into place. Today, Pastor Al Dagel brings another piece of that puzzle into view for us.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode

item.title: Beware His anger
item.description: Are you afraid of God's anger? There might be good reason to fear, but Pastor Al Dagel also shares some good reasons to be encouraged to let God work His ways in you. Don't put off dealing with what otherwise might make God angry with you.

item.title: Your annointed beard
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares some thoughts on unity from Psalm 133:1-3. Do you have an annointed kind of unity?

item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares some thoughts on unity from Psalm 133:1-3. Do you have an annointed kind of unity?

item.title: For richer - for poorer
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us who needs to be redeemed, and he tell us who is able to pay the price for the redemption of those in need. You will want to share this devotioncast with your rich and poor friends alike.

item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel tells us who needs to be redeemed, and he tell us who is able to pay the price for the redemption of those in need. You will want to share this devotioncast with your rich and poor friends alike.

item.title: At long last, salvation!
item.description: Today, the remedy for our sin problem unfolds, and Pastor Al Dagel lets us know how to be forgiven, and how to tell others about our Savior!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, the remedy for our sin problem unfolds, and Pastor Al Dagel lets us know how to be forgiven, and how to tell others about our Savior!

item.title: The problem is sin.
item.description: In today's lesson on sharing our faith, Pastor Al Dagel, still keeping to the simplest of messages, lets us know the "The problem is sin." If you need the whole plan of salvation, e-mail Pastor Al right now at 1gracemode@gmail.com.

item.title: Share God's love
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares part one of how to share the simple gospel message. This is elementary, but powerful. Don't miss any of this series!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares part one of how to share the simple gospel message. This is elementary, but powerful. Don't miss any of this series!

item.title: Don't be shy
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel begins a challenge to us to share our faith in Christ. He lets us know that being shy will not be a good enough reason not to tell of God's wonderful love for the lost, so listen, be challenged and be obedient!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel begins a challenge to us to share our faith in Christ. He lets us know that being shy will not be a good enough reason not to tell of God's wonderful love for the lost, so listen, be challenged and be obedient!

item.title: The passover lambs
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel looks at to Passover accounts. Time would not allow great detail, so Pastor Al urges us to read more on our own. After all, we should get to know God's love letter to us!
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Today, Pastor Al Dagel looks at to Passover accounts. Time would not allow great detail, so Pastor Al urges us to read more on our own. After all, we should get to know God's love letter to us!

item.title: Joseph already knew
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel wants us to understand that God's truth is eternal. Before Paul wrote Romans 8:28, Joseph put it into practice throughout all of his years in Egypt. We can learn New Testament principles from men like Joseph.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Al Dagel wants us to understand that God's truth is eternal. Before Paul wrote Romans 8:28, Joseph put it into practice throughout all of his years in Egypt. We can learn New Testament principles from men like Joseph.

item.title: "Peace, be still!"
item.description: Oh, the power of the spoken word of God the Son. Pastor Al Dagel believes that the One Who calmed the waters can also calm our hearts.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Oh, the power of the spoken word of God the Son. Pastor Al Dagel believes that the One Who calmed the waters can also calm our hearts.

item.title: Gideons and GraceMode
item.description: Pastor Al and Eloise Dagel enjoyed Friday evening's "Pastor's appreciation banquet", sponsored by the Colorado members of the Gideons International at the Pueblo Convention Center. Pastor Al couldn't help but notice that the similarities between the Gideons and GraceMode. Both love the Lord and His Word, and both endeavor to reach the lost with the gospel.

item.title: A bigger picture
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel shares from a communication from Pastor Prem Raulo from Orissa, India, detailing how God is at work in his part of the world. Pastor Al wants us to understand how important others in God's family are to us, wherever they serve. If you need information about Faith Ministries in Orissa, India, contact Pastor Al at gracemode@gmail.com.

item.title: How is your walk?
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel answered a personal question posed by a Pakistani pastor, and he wants to encourage us to ask ourselves the same question. Listen, as Pastor Al narrows the focus right down to "personal".

item.title: Our Passover Lamb
item.description: Nothing opens our eyes wider than to see the sacrificial Lamb of God pictured clearly in the Old Testament. Today, Pastor Al Dagel takes us back to the Book of Exodus and the occasion of the first Passover. It tells quite a story, the story of our redemption.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode

item.title: Ordinary people
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel attempts to encourage ordinary people to become available to God to do extraordinary things through His power. If you don't think God can use you, think again. He can use any of us, but He would prefer that we offer Him willing hearts, that He might use us as His own hands here on earth.

item.title: James on faith and works
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel wants us to clearly see what James taught concerning our faith and our works. Some find conflict here. Pastor Al finds peace.
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Al Dagel wants us to clearly see what James taught concerning our faith and our works. Some find conflict here. Pastor Al finds peace.

item.title: The three last words.
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel really identifies with the three last words of one of the psalms. We hope these three words will fill your heart with joy and praise for the Father. Enjoy a few moments in Psalm 117, and be blessed.

item.title: Where is your confidence
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel shares an account of misplaced confidence. The results were tragic. Pastor Al urges us to be sure to place our confidence in God. When we do, we will certainly not be misled.

item.title: Contrasts
item.description: In today's episode of "Moments of Grace", Pastor Al Dagel exposed some contrasts that might just get us to thinking about our responses to the Savior. don't forget to share this episode with your friends. Check out the Web page, too. gracemode.org is ready for you

item.title: For the children
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel encourages us to become involved in reaching out to children, whether through Child Evangelism Fellowship, Awana Ministries, Sunday school or other outreach ministries, but he also shares today how believers might help in a practical, though unexpected way called CASA.

item.title: Reason for comfort
item.description: Suffering the loss of a loved one or friend? Find comfort in the risen Savior! Pastor Al Dagel shares that hope from Paul's first epistle to the Thessalonian believers, and the message of hope is still potent for us today.

item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel opens a familiar story to our understanding, as he shares his own challenge to be excited about the gospel. Join Pastor Al today, and please consider sharing this episode with a friend.

item.title: Join the club
item.description: Ever want to do something great that just was not possible! Pastor Al Dagel tells us that many, including King David, have had such unfulfilled dreams. God's plans for us glorifying His Name might not exactly match our plans.

item.title: Tested like Abraham
item.description: Pastor Al Dagel never faced the test of Abraham, who was instructed to offer his only son as a burnt offering, but Pastor Al notes that God faced the same test, and we are the beneficiaries. Need counsel about your own salvation, e-mail Pastor Al at 1gracemode@gmail.com.

item.title: A reminder . . .
item.description: Holy week is a fond memory, and Pastor Al Dagel gives us an important reminder of a beginning of the carrying out of God's plan for the redemption of mankind, found in the first chapter of the Gospel according to Matthew. We believe that this is a good reminder.

item.title: Something to think on
item.description: In the third psalm, Pastor Al Dagel found David's secret to a good night's sleep. That may be an overstatement, but Pastor Al certainly gives us food for thought in today's episode of "Moments of Grace".

item.title: Everything has changed!
item.description: After the resurrection, everything changed for the disciples, and now that we have been made aware of the resurrection ourselves, nothing can ever be the same again. Pastor Al Dagel challenges us to respond in faith and obedience to our risen Lord!

item.title: I believe anyway!
item.description: Today is resurrection Sunday, Easter, and Pastor Al Dagel is in awe of the resurrection. He believes that we are blessed, because, even though we have not seen the risen Lord, we have believed. Does that describe you? If not, Pastor Al is waiting for your e-mail at 1gracemode@gmail.com. He'll be happy to help you get to know the Savior.

item.title: A quiet Sabbath day
item.description: On the Sabbath day in Holy Week, things were probably very quiet and somber, but Pastor Al Dagel believes that there were many interesting conversations going on, anticipating how different life would be after the Sabbath day.

item.title: The trials of Jesus
item.description: In the last days of Holy Week, Pastor Al Dagel looks briefly at the trials of Jesus. Was He guilty of being a king? Was He worthy of death? "Worthy is the Lamb!"
item.dc:creator: GraceMode
item.itunes:summary: In the last days of Holy Week, Pastor Al Dagel looks briefly at the trials of Jesus. Was He guilty of being a king? Was He worthy of death? "Worthy is the Lamb!"

item.title: The will of the Father
item.description: When Jesus prayed the His Father's will would be done, Pastor Al Dagel believes that He opened the door for our salvation, which, of course, is the will of the Father, "that all men might be saved." Don't miss this episode of "Moments of Grace!"

item.title: The Smell of Salvation
item.description: All throughout holy week, Jesus smelled like oil of spikenard, after having his feet washed with it at the hands of Mary, a friend of Jesus. Pastor Al Dagel believes that that sweet smell lingered, even into the tomb, and, perhaps there was still that fragrance lingering after the resurrection. Listen to "The Smell of Salvation" now, and tell a friend about "Moments of Grace today.

item.title: Authority to preach
item.description: Who would dare question God's authority to cleanse the temple or preach the Gospel? Some could not grasp the fact that Jesus is God the Son. Pastor Al Dagel brings us face to face with the One Who displayed God's authority in today's episode of "Moments of Grace."

item.description: Today is Palm Sunday, and Pastor Al Dagel helps us understand why a little donkey was chosen to bring Jesus into Jerusalem. Wouldn't a king ride in on a war horse? Listen to Pastor Al's answer. Questions? 1gracemode@gmail.com

item.description: Before Jesus made His triumphal entry into Jerusalem, He told His disciples the truth, when He gave the Gospel account of His death, burial and resurrection before it happened. Pastor Al Dagel wants us to keep telling that message.

item.description: In part two of "A healthy tree, Pastor Al Dagel looks at the contrasting description of people who are not like the healthy tree described in both Psalm 1 and Jeremiah 17. Find out more about Lena's ministry at cedaruganda.blogspot.com.

item.title: Time to get Courageous
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel reminds of of motivational speeches and meetings that loose their fire when the meeting hall empties, but he does encourage us to get and stay motivated by going to the movie, "Courageous". We must not only be motivate. . . we must be accountable to each other! Pastor Al reminds us of Joshua's motivational phrase, "As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord!"

item.title: I'll be brief
item.description: Today, Pastor Al Dagel identifies with the Apostle John's sense of frustration, as he wrote a short letter, hoping to spend time face to face with the recipients of this epistle. Pastor Al loves these moments together, but he would love to spend more time with you, face to face or in your church, as he shares the ministry of GraceMode.

item.title: Thank you!

item.title: Unity builds walls of protection
item.description: Just as unity and resolve, mixed with a well executed plan of armed security, brought Nehemiah & his volunteers together to rebuild the wall around Jerusalem, the tenth anniversary of the attacks of September 11, 2001 should bring us together to guard our cities, countries and families. Pastor Al Dagel urges us to display God's love in unity, even reaching out to our enemies in love. We believe that this is a good episode to share.
